reviewText: Hell's Kitchen Season 1 is a nice start to the show. It's not crazy but that allows the cast to grow on you. However there is a clear divide between chef's who have no hope, chef's who start fine but are on a sinking ship, and the chef's that demonstrate potential to stay in the game longer. But even that last group has strong/weak division. I enjoyed this season but it is slower then other seasons.For me it worked as I enjoyed this cast but for some it won't for many understandable reasons. I like this season but it's one of the lower seasons I like.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Super chef Gordon Ramsey whose Hell's Kitchen series debuted in 2005 in the U.S. after a successful run on the BBC,where it originated,is now on DVD.I must admit I did not buy this set but was given it by a friend to review.....thank goodness.I am also NOT a fan of so called "reality" TV(the most cheap and bankrupt type of television ever)and cannot for the life of me think what attraction people could have to such a vile and horrid show as Hell's Kitchen.The premise is simple:Own a restaurant,get some tenderfoot chefs in to berate and swear at continually,then in the end pick the best,i.e the one who can withstand Ramsey's continual verbal onslaughts the longest.It is amazing what people will subject themselves to for their 15 minutes of fame but it is even more amazing that people would actually watch and even consider buying this tripe.This is about the most disgusting show I have ever seen and I would never in a million years ever recommend this visual garbage to anyone.It is a total embarrassment to its participants and an insult to we the viewers.I will not give you the specs or any more info as that would be aiding and abetting Ramsey.If there were NO stars,this is what I would give it.Absolute crap.
summary: Hell's Kitchen aptly describes where this series should be!
Title: N/A
